Reviews.Title: Awesome HDTV
Reviews.Author: Fabian "Fabi"
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely great ... I do not know why nobody has made a useful comment about this product ... I bought it for my Xbox 360 and the PS3 too, and the quality of the image and sound is AWESOME ... I love it!

Reviews.Title: Sound issue
Reviews.Author: NostalgicMom
Reviews.Content: We wanted to replace 2 dying crt tvs with 2 new lcds. This philips seemed to be a great value for the price and the reviews were good. Shortly after receiving and testing both new tvs from amazon I began to question my sanity. I heard high pitched sounds whenever either tv was turned on. The sound stayed even when muted and after disconnected from any other device. The only way to stop it was to turn off the tv. Turned on again the 'mosquito on steroids' sound would be back. Each time louder than before. It has gotten so distracting now that I actually had to dig out our old crt tubes again. This constant squealing just makes the new tvs absolute useless. I am really disappointed but this philips tv just does not seem to be as good as it appeared at first. I am however very thankful to the reviewer who had the same problem and posted about it. I worried that I MUST have been imagining things since nobody else talked about this sound issue. Btw. the picture quality was very nice.Update: We had actually bought 3 of these tvs at the same time. Only 2 had the sound problems. The 3rd tv is working wonderful from day one. No squeal or other issues.

Reviews.Title: What a great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: vtxdude "ristorap"
Reviews.Content: I recently rearranged my home office and have been looking for a small TV to put on my desk.  Like Bob mentioned I saw this on clearance at Target for 150.00.  I've only had it a couple of days but so far so good and HD channels look fantastic.  Absolutely perfect for what I wanted it for and a steal at Target..... and not that bad priced here.  Looking for a sub 200 dollar TV?  Look no further

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Roberto Vitale
Reviews.Content: I only have it for a few hours, but I am impress. It is easy to install, better of-the-air reception and video than my OLD TV, and a great value.The audio is also good enough so you do not need external speakers/system. Keeping in mind is a $150 on-sale-TV at Target, it is an incredible buy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for small bedroom.
Reviews.Author: TronixSage
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for an elderly family member who wanted it in her bedroom.I spent a few weeks doing research and narrowed it down to this model and a comparable Samsung model. Ultimately, the price was the main deciding factor and she went with the Philips.I had the TV shipped to my office and I just plugged in my Sony DVP-SR500H DVD player and started to watch Despicable Me.Set-up was nothing more than plugging everything in and answering a few questions that were on the screen when I turned the TV on.The movie plays very smooth, colors needed a bit of tuning - but weren't too far off and the clarity of this SD DVD is amazing.Later that afternoon I set the TV up and watched regular SD cable. The picture quality was above average considering the cable feed was not HD.Like most flat panel TV's the sound could be better, but it's perfectly fine. Any elderly person who is hard of hearing shouldn't have a problem with the sound on this TV. The sound is very clear and at not even half-way up, its a bit too loud for my 15'x15' office.Overall, this is a very nice little TV. For $150 how can you go wrong?Would definitely recommend to someone looking for a 19" TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Small TV
Reviews.Author: K. M. Sandlin
Reviews.Content: I remember Phillips products from years ago and felt confident in purchasing this television. I was not disappointed. The TV is light weight, and the perfect size for a dresser in a bedroom. The picture is very clear and high quality. The remote is easy to use and I'm very happy with my purchase. I love the TV.The TV was delivered quickly and the packaging was just like it would be if I bought it at the store. There were no additional boxes or crates. That was a bit surprising, but the TV was in perfect condition so the extra packaging did not seem to be necessary.

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV
Reviews.Author: K. J. Troyer
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV to have in our kitchen so when we are in there we can watch sports and the kids can watch cartoons. It is a very nice little tv, great picture quality, even without the HDMi cables. Easy to mount on a swivel arm wall mount- not too heavy that one person can't do it.My only complaint is the sound- and it has nothing to to with quality. The quality is fine, no negatives- but the volume has to be turned to nearly the highest numbers to be heard! When turned to 100% (all the way at top volume) it is a good level for cooking and still being able to hear. If I wanted it higher- there would be no way to do that! It is a good thing that I mostly watch sports while in the kitchen, and, to me, the volume doesn't really matter. I have given up trying to watch any shows that I have to actually hear the dialogue. I tried different settings (there is a doctor's office setting, which limits the volume even more!) but can't get the volume to be any more "normal". With the volume turned to around 25%- it is nearly mute.Otherwise, I really love this tv. THe volume is a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: I wish I could keep this TV!
Reviews.Author: Berry Blue
Reviews.Content: The TV is great but it emits a high frequency tone that is REALLY annoying.  Even if the sound is muted it still emits this constant high frequency tone.  I've never had this happen with a TV before.  Picture quality is really nice though but unfortunately this is getting returned!

Reviews.Title: Surprised
Reviews.Author: E. Carswell
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the picture quality for such a small television.  Others have commented on it as well.  The picture is absolutely beautiful.  It is sharp and clear and can be seen from any angle.  The sound is great also.  I don't even have cable on this tv (just the converter box and an antenna) and the picture is sharper than my large tv which has cable.  Great quality

Reviews.Title: This One's a Keeper!
Reviews.Author: S. A. Rose
Reviews.Content: SquareTrade 3-Year Electronics Warranty ($125-150 Items)Every good comment about this TV is true of mine. I've only had it for about 24 hours, but so far it's great. I live in a retirement community where the sound carries terribly from one apartment to the next. I bought this little TV to set on a side table next to my recliner. I can keep the volume low enough that it doesn't disturb my neighbors or even use my iPod's earbuds if I want to turn it up.It took me 30 minutes to get it set up and most of that time was spent screwing the stand on the base of the TV. The picture is perfect. I did go back and tweak the color a little, manually. But I eventually got it just the way I wanted it. No problem connecting my DVD player or setting up cable.If there is a problem, it is that the picture is too big to be as close as I have it - 3-4ft. I could have easily used a 16 in. But this one is the best buy for the money I have no regrets. Picture and sound with cable are as good as I've ever seen.Kudos, as usual, to Amazon and UPS. I ordered the TV on Feb. 1. It got caught in the snow storm in Indiana - Shipped Feb. 5 with a delivery date of Feb. 9. I kept checking the tracking updates and watching the weather in the news. I was notified that delivery was delayed - but they evidently made up the time because it showed up on Feb. 9 as scheduled. It was nice to be able to check the progress each day on the tracking.I plan to buy the 3 year warranty from Square Trade for $20 from Amazon with the option to add a year making it 4 years for $10 more. I love this TV, but I'm not taking any chances.P.S. I've had mine for a month now and just want to say I've had absolutely no problems with it whatsoever. I love everything about it - all the way down to the user friendly remote control.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Mark C. Reymiller
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with purchase process and product.  Arrived ahead of date promised in pristine condition and performs quite well.  A great TV for small room application or where portability is desired.  We have had a 42" Phillips flat panel plasma TV for over five years now that continues to perform flawlessly.Highly recommend all Phillips products!

Reviews.Title: good  Small HDTV
Reviews.Author: rock13gone
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 2 weeks ago, used for $118!! It was a very good price for a small HDTV. I was a little worried about buying this TV, heard a lot of good and bad from other reviews!It came in a very large box for a 19" tv, no origanal boxing (A little disapointing) but came with everything necesarry (tv, power cord, remote, and stand,).The TV worked great for its use, as a small HDTV for video gaming is bedroom. The HD graphics looked great with my Xbox 360, small but good for one person. The only proble I have is that the volume either doesnt work or is really low unless you turn it up all the way. So i will be buying some speakers and would recomending doing so. otherwise havent had any problems yet, but only had it for 2 weeks!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Kenneth W. Moore
Reviews.Content: This TV worked great right out of the box.  Took only a few minutes to set it up and start watching programming.  I have a Samsung 32"and it is easily as good as it.  I highly recommend this TV at this price point.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: bbm
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a Christmas gift for my 12-year-old. It replaced a Magnavox which died after only a year. It's only been a month but, so far it's looking pretty good. It was a breeze to set up: just plug in, hook up cable, hit channel setup, and begin watching. Picture is just fine, sound is good for a 12-year-old's bedroom. I used the included stand instead of wall-mounting. The price was good on Amazon, although I found it cheaper closer to Christmas in stores, of course, after I'd already bought it. The price was only about $10 cheaper, worth it to me to avoid the lines and to guarantee I got it. It actually got to me a day or two earlier than was listed as delivery date. Overall, I'd recommend it for use as a kid's TV.

Reviews.Title: good 2nd TV
Reviews.Author: claires
Reviews.Content: I love phillips, and this TV is no exception, the volume doesn't go up very high, but its a great 2nd TV for my bedroom and well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: descent deal
Reviews.Author: jonathan a maxon
Reviews.Content: This was a decent deal. works fine. we use it for cartoons in the kids room, it takes a lickin and keeps on tickin

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: nicholas
Reviews.Content: I have had this T.V. for many months and it is awesome and the seller did a great job,cant ask for more...i am loving this product immensely.

Reviews.Title: Great little HDTV
Reviews.Author: S. Eiswirth
Reviews.Content: I have this mounted high on the wall in my basement by my treadmill. Picture is very nice. The best picture I've seen on it, however, is via a digital antenna. After 20 min. or so of setup time, it gives me an awesome HD picture of local over the air signals. So far it's been very reliable. I have zero complaints about this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great price and product
Reviews.Author: Martyb
Reviews.Content: We needed a new TV for our kitchen and it was difficult to find a smaller TV for the space we had in a local store, so I checked online.  I am very pleased with this TV and have had no problems with the TV. Clear picture, easy remote and no sound problems as others have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Alrev
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. A co-worker bought another brand but return it for this one. It's worth the money. I cannot state a reason why I would not purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome HD picture
Reviews.Author: DSL430
Reviews.Content: We love this TV. It saves so much space in our bedroom compared to our old model. It has a great picture and the sound quality is good. I don't think you can beat it for the price. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Love this little TV!
Reviews.Author: Karen W.
Reviews.Content: This is my first new TV in 20+ years.  My old TV was 19", so I thought it would be the same size screen - it isn't.  It's a little TV, but I have a small space, and it's big enough for me. I'm very happy with it.  I don't have cable, so I needed the HD antenna I had for the old TV.  I connected my DVD player directly to the TV.  I connected my VCR through the DTV converter box.  They both work perfectly.  Haven't tried to record on the VCR yet.  I needed to get eHow directions to help me make my connections.  I have to adjust the antenna a lot between stations, but I think I will get better with that. I just checked the antenna directions, and there are some adjustments I didn't know about.  Overall, this is a great TV, at an excellent price, and, if you don't want to hook anything up to it, it is very easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Marigold
Reviews.Content: This tv is a very good deal for the price and amazing quality.  I would highly recomend this for anyone who wants a small television in their bedroom or kitchen.  Although it is good to keep in mind that the screen itself is not 19 inchs, the entire thing is.  Besides that, i haven't found any flaws.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Marya
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for almost a week, having purchased it based on the excellent reviews. I don't have any problem with the sound, but I find that the picture quality is extremely disappointing. There are four different ways to adjust the picture settings and format, and I have tried (and tried) them all.The short story:I find that whatever picture settings I settle on for one program have to be changed for a different program or even for a different scene in the same program. Also, there seems to be an overall greenish/yellow cast to all pictures, regardless of settings.The long story:1. I've adjusted and readjusted my choices in the Settings Assistant -- a series of vertically split scenes where you choose whether the left or right side of the picture is more pleasing to you. The left side seems to favor greenish yellow, the right side reddish orange. The least worst choices were on the right side, but then all the reds are brilliant purple/orange (and still have the greenish cast). I've tried alternating my choices between the two sides, choosing equally, but that resulting picture is too green.2. I've done the same with Auto Picture, which is differentiated into Personal (own settings), Standard, Sports, Movie, and Game.3. Personal settings include Brightness, Contrast, Color, Tint, Sharpness, Temperature, which so far I've readjusted for every program I've watched. The Brightness setting (to adjust the dark areas) may be fine for one scene, but looks bleached-out for the next scene or program. Same with the Contrast setting (which adjusts light areas).4. The picture formats (aspect ratios) are also frustrating, with some leaving just a tiny picture in the middle of an already small screen. The best I've settled on is a Zoom format, which doesn't distort the image (16:9) and fills the screen, but cuts off a bit at the top and bottom.I've finally settled on the settings that allow me to have a not-too-unpleasant picture experience (a bit too dark for dark scenes, a bit too light for bright scenes) but I will say that I have never had a problem like this. I have a larger LG flatscreen where I adjusted all the settings once, about a year and a half ago when I got it. Same with all the old CRT tvs I've had over the years -- adjusted once at the beginning and that's it. For this tv I've been fiddling with the settings several times each evening, each program, for most of this week. Even a relatively inexpensive tv should not have this problem. Based on everyone else's reviews, I assume this one is a lemon, but I am unable to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Carol DiPietro
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present for my parents and so far it seems to be a great TV for the money.  Very light and easy to install on wall mount (although I used an articulating mount purchased separately, not the enclosed mount).  Nice clear, crisp picture.  Overall, very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: Brian Bigelow "Brian Bigelow"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up, it took about 5 minutes total. Also, I feel that it was an excellent value for the money. I've always trusted Phillips products, I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Bad Choice
Reviews.Author: DMFC
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift to replace a smaller TV that is used mainly as a VGA monitor (the TV tuner was a bonus). What a waste of time and money. After getting the whole thing mounted on the wall, verifying TV software was up to date, I hooked PC up to VGA input. The graphics looked like a CGA monitor. PC works great with previous monitor/TV and it was the same VGA cable. After trying to change resolution on PC and a second VGA cable (just in case) the VGA input on the new TV stopped working at all. Spend a little extra and get a decent unit. This one is just a waste of time and money. (I bought mine from a seller on Amazon, but I don't think it was a seller issue. Just a lousy TV.)

ProductInfo.Features:
2 HDMI inputs
PC input via VGA
5 ms response time
Easy Link HDMI
Energy Star 4.0
ProductInfo.Name: Philips 19PFL3505D/F7 19-inch LCD HDTV, Black (2011 Model)
